channel.title: Compilers on Garrett Battaglia
channel.description: Recent content in Compilers on Garrett Battaglia

item.title: Linkers, do they do things, what do they do, lets find out
item.description: If you write C or C++ chances are you’ve used a makefile a time or two and there is always a rule to take all the object files and combine them into the final executable. usually something along the lines of gcc -o output foo1.o foo2.o foo3.o. To answer what that’s doing we have to back up to what an object file is and how it is made. To understand what an object file is lets first talk about compilers.
